com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.options

Enum ScaleType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ScaleType>
      • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.options.ScaleType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ScaleType>

    public enum ScaleType
extends Enum<ScaleType>
    The type of scale (maximum and minimum values shown on the Y axis).

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ALLFIXED
      Same as FIXED, but used when multiple scales are displayed.
      ALLMAXIMIZED
      Same as MAXIMIZED, but used when multiple scales are displayed.
      FIXED
      The Y axis varies, depending on the data values values: If all values are >=0, the Y axis will span from zero to the maximum data value. If all values are <=0, the Y axis will span from zero to the minimum data value. If values are both positive and negative, the Y axis will range from the series maximum to the series minimum. For multiple series, use ALLFIXED.
      MAXIMIZED
      The Y axis will span the minimum to the maximum values of the series.
      If you have more than one series, use ALLMAXIMIZED.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • MAXIMIZED

        public static final ScaleType MAXIMIZED
        The Y axis will span the minimum to the maximum values of the series.
        If you have more than one series, use ALLMAXIMIZED.

      • FIXED

        public static final ScaleType FIXED
        The Y axis varies, depending on the data values values:
        • If all values are >=0, the Y axis will span from zero to the maximum data value.
        • If all values are <=0, the Y axis will span from zero to the minimum data value.
        • If values are both positive and negative, the Y axis will range from the series maximum to the series minimum.
        For multiple series, use ALLFIXED.

      • ALLMAXIMIZED

        public static final ScaleType ALLMAXIMIZED
        Same as MAXIMIZED, but used when multiple scales are displayed. Both charts will be maximized within the same scale, which means that one will be misrepresented against the Y axis, but hovering over each series will display its true value.

      • ALLFIXED

        public static final ScaleType ALLFIXED
        Same as FIXED, but used when multiple scales are displayed. This setting adjusts each scale to the series to which it applies (use this in conjunction with AnnotationChartOptions.setScaleColumns(int...)).
